013    package net.sf.oval.constraint;
014    
015    import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
016    import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017    import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018    import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019    import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020    
021    import net.sf.oval.ConstraintTarget;
022    import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
023    import net.sf.oval.configuration.annotation.Constraint;
024    
025    /**
026     * Check if the specified regular expression pattern is matched.
027     * 
028     * <br><br>
029     * <b>Note:</b> This constraint is also satisfied when the value to validate is null, therefore you might also need to specified @NotNull
030     * 
031     * @author Sebastian Thomschke
032     */
033    @Documented
034    @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
035    @Target({ElementType.FIELD, ElementType.PARAMETER, ElementType.METHOD})
036    @Constraint(checkWith = MatchPatternCheck.class)
037    public @interface MatchPattern
038    {
039            /**
040             * <p>In case the constraint is declared for an array, collection or map this controls how the constraint is applied to it and it's child objects.
041             * 
042             * <p><b>Default:</b> ConstraintTarget.VALUES
043             * 
044             * <p><b>Note:</b> This setting is ignored for object types other than array, map and collection.
045             */
046            ConstraintTarget[] appliesTo() default ConstraintTarget.VALUES;
047            
048            /**
049             * error code passed to the ConstraintViolation object
050             */
051            String errorCode() default "net.sf.oval.constraint.MatchPattern";
052    
053            /**
054             *  Match flags, a bit mask that may include
055             *         Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE, Pattern.MULTILINE, Pattern.DOTALL,
056             *         Pattern.UNICODE_CASE, Pattern.CANON_EQ
057             *
058             * @see java.util.regex.Pattern
059             */
060            int[] flags() default 0;
061    
062            /**
063             * specifies if all of the declared patterns must match or if one is sufficient 
064             */
065            boolean matchAll() default true;
066    
067            /**
068             * message to be used for the ContraintsViolatedException
069             * 
070             * @see ConstraintViolation
071             */
072            String message() default "net.sf.oval.constraint.MatchPattern.violated";
073    
074            /**
075             * The regular expression(s) to match against
076             * <br><br>
077             * Examples:<br>
078             * decimal number: "^-{0,1}(\\d*|(\\d{1,3}([,]\\d{3})*))[.]?\\d*$"<br>
079             * numbers only: "^\\d*$"<br>
080             * e-mail address: "^([a-z0-9]{1,}[\\.\\_\\-]?[a-z0-9]{1,})\\@([a-z0-9]{2,}\\.)([a-z]{2,2}|org|net|com|gov|edu|int|info|biz|museum)$"<br>
081             * 
082             * @see java.util.regex.Pattern
083             */
084            String[] pattern();
085    
086            /**
087             * The associated constraint profiles.
088             */
089            String[] profiles() default {};
090    
091            /**
092             * severity passed to the ConstraintViolation object
093             */
094            int severity() default 0;
095    
096            /**
097             * Formula returning <code>true</code> if this constraint shall be evaluated and
098             * <code>false</code> if it shall be ignored for the current validation.
099             * <p>
100             * <b>Important:</b> The formula must be prefixed with the name of the scripting language that is used.
101             * E.g. <code>groovy:_this.amount > 10</code>
102             * <p>
103             * Available context variables are:<br>
104             * <b>_this</b> -&gt; the validated bean<br>
105             * <b>_value</b> -&gt; the value to validate (e.g. the field value, parameter value, method return value,
106             *    or the validated bean for object level constraints)
107             */
108            String when() default "";
109    }
